class BtServiceRequest

Detailed Description

The communication between the application and the various kinds of the Bt...Controller classes is done via BtServiceRequests. The class BtService is the base class for all services supported by the Bluetooth Stack. It forms an container for all requests of on particular profile. This class is abstract because it primarily defines the basic functionalities to all services. Each service that is supported by the Bluetooth Stack must implement a Bt...Controller and a Bt...Service class.

Member Function Documentation

virtual BtProfile BtService::GetProfile (   )  const [pure virtual]
 

Get the profile this service is associated with.

GetProfile returns the profile for which this service provides the interface, so in the base class, it is a pure virtual function.

Returns:
A BtProfile enumeration type containing the profile this service is associated with.

Implemented in BtAvrcpService, BtBppService, BtSddbService, BtDunService, BtFaxService, BtHfService, BtHsService, and BtObexService.

virtual BtRequestState BtService::GetRequestState (  BtRequestType  request_type  )  const [pure virtual]
 

Implemented in BtAvrcpOperationService, BtAvrcpRegistrationService, BtBppClientService, BtBppServerService, BtSddbService, BtDunService, BtFaxService, BtHfService, BtHsService, BtObexClientService, and BtObexServerService.

BtDevice & BtService::GetTargetDevice (   ) 
 

Get the remote device this service addresses.

Each BtService class addresses exactly one remote device. For profiles supporting more than one remote device there must be more than one instance of that prarticular servce.
GetTargetDevice returns the remote device, which this service addresses.

Returns:
A reference to a BtDevice containing the target remote device.

const BtDevice & BtService::GetTargetDevice (   )  const
 

Get the remote device this service addresses.

Each BtService class addresses exactly one remote device. For profiles supporting more than one remote device there must be more than one instance of that prarticular servce.
GetTargetDevice returns the remote device, which this service addresses.

Returns:
A reference to a BtDevice containing the target remote device.

virtual void BtService::OnRequestStateChange (  BtRequestType  request_type,
BtRequestState  old_request_state,
BtRequestState  new_request_state
)  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Notification function of changes in running requests.

Whenever the state of a request contained in this service is changed OnRequestStateChange will be called. This function should give the application programmer to do some GUI reaction to the progress or the failure of a partikular request.
This function has to be implemented by the application programmer, so in the base classes this function is pure virtual.

Parameters:
request_type A BtRequestType enumeration type describing which kind of request has changed its state.
old_request_state A BtRequestState enumeration type containing the state of the request before the state transition.
new_request_state A BtRequestState enumeration type containing the state of the request after the state transition.

Implemented in BtObexClientServiceImpl, BtObexSddbImpl, BtObexServerServiceImpl, BtAvrcpProfileRegistrationService, BtAvrcpProfileOperationService, BtDunProfileService, BtFaxProfileService, BtHfProfileService, and BtHsProfileService.

virtual void BtService::RequestStateChangeCallback (  BtServiceRequest *  request,
BtRequestState  old_request_state,
BtRequestState  new_request_state
)  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Implemented in BtAvrcpOperationService, BtAvrcpRegistrationService, BtBppService, BtSddbService, BtDunService, BtFaxService, and BtObexService.

void BtService::SetTargetDevice (  const BtDevice &  target_device  )  [virtual]
 

Sets the remote device this service addresses.

Each BtService class addresses exactly one remote device. For profiles supporting more than one remote device there must be more than one instance of that prarticular servce.
SetTargetDevice sets the remote device, that this service addresses.

Parameters:
target_device A reference to a BtDevice containing the remote device this service should address.

Reimplemented in BtHfService, and BtHsService.
